questions.question: What is Deep Learning?
options: A) A subset of machine learning that uses neural networks with multiple layers
B) A method for data visualization
C) A technique for feature selection

questions.question: Which type of neural network is commonly used for image classification?
What is the purpose of a 'convolutional layer' in a CNN?
options: A) To extract features from input data

questions.question: Which activation function is commonly used in the hidden layers of a neural network?
What does 'backpropagation' refer to in the context of deep learning?
options: A) The process of training a neural network by adjusting weights based on error
B) A method for feature selection
C) A technique for data normalization

questions.question: Which type of neural network is commonly used for natural language processing?
What is the purpose of a 'recurrent layer' in an RNN?
options: A) To extract features from input data

questions.question: Which algorithm is commonly used for unsupervised learning in deep learning?
What does 'dropout' refer to in the context of deep learning?
options: A) A technique for preventing overfitting by randomly setting a fraction of input units to 0 at each update during training
B) A method for feature selection
C) A technique for data normalization

questions.question: Which type of neural network is commonly used for time series forecasting?
What is the purpose of a 'fully connected layer' in a neural network?
options: A) To extract features from input data
C) To connect all neurons in one layer to all neurons in another layer

questions.question: Which technique is commonly used for training deep neural networks?
What does 'transfer learning' refer to in the context of deep learning?
options: A) The process of training a neural network from scratch using new data
B) The process of adapting a pre-trained model to a new task with limited data
C) A method for feature selection

questions.question: Which type of neural network is commonly used for generative tasks?
What is the purpose of a 'discriminator' in a GAN?
options: A) To generate data that resembles real data
B) To distinguish between real and generated data

questions.question: Which type of neural network is commonly used for reinforcement learning?
What does 'batch normalization' refer to in the context of deep learning?
options: A) A technique for preventing overfitting by randomly setting a fraction of input units to 0 at each update during training
B) A method for normalizing inputs to each layer
C) A technique for data normalization

questions.question: Which type of neural network is commonly used for computer vision tasks?
What is the purpose of a 'pooling layer' in a CNN?
options: A) To extract features from input data
B) To reduce the spatial dimensions of the feature maps

questions.question: Which type of neural network is commonly used for speech recognition?
What is the purpose of a 'softmax layer' in a neural network?
options: A) To extract features from input data
B) To perform classification tasks by outputting probabilities for each class

questions.question: Which type of neural network is commonly used for recommendation systems?
What does 'overfitting' mean in the context of deep learning?
options: A) The model performs well on training data but poorly on unseen data
B) The model performs poorly on both training and unseen data
C) The model performs well on both training and unseen data

questions.question: Which technique is commonly used to prevent overfitting in deep learning?
